description: Borrowed from Hindi बंगला (baṅglā, “Bengali”), referring to the Bengali-style house. Compare Gujarati બંગલો (baṅglo) and Bengali বাংলা (baṅla). Doublet of bangalo.

entries.meaning: A single-storey house, typically with rooms all on one level, or sometimes also with upper rooms set into the roof space.
examples: My aunt can't manage the stairs any more, so she's moving to a bungalow.

entries.meaning: A thatched or tiled one-story house in India surrounded by a wide veranda; a similar house in this style.
